review_title: GVS Insight/ Pre sales/ Sales consulting/ Tele sales- Gurgaon
job_title: Senior Principal Consultant in Gurgaon, Haryana
pros:
- Work Life Balance: No one stays in the office for more than 7.5 hours and there is no carrying work to home
- A heaven for those who don't want to work/are lazy/incompetent, as you are not accountable for the quality of your work
cons:
GVS insight/presales/Sales consulting/ Tele sales/cloud sales consulting- Gurgaon: 
 People are stuck in this profile for years with no salary increment or negative appraisal. This team works like a bania shop. It was a 30 members team until two year back which is now reduced to 15. Oracle is about to layoff 15,000 people in India. I am afraid they might close down this team too as management does not see value in the work team is delivering.
- No professional development or training
- None of the policy is employee friendly
- No annual appraisal or performance review as there is no increment since past 7 years
- Recently they drastically decreased their variable salary (which is 20% of the total package) by 90% without any prior notice or discussion
- When you approach management to discuss this issue they show you the door and say that it’s an efficient market and you are free to look out for the better opportunity
- There is no HR policy/Connect: you only meet HR once i.e. at the time of induction
- If you still want to join this profile then start searching for a better opportunity as soon as you join the company and take everything they promise in writing because they will go back on their commitment that they make at the time of salary negotiation.
A guide for salary negotiation: When I joined the company they used to offer packages around 10 lakhs but now they have significantly increased that.  There is no cap on % of hike that you can get over your current CTC (people have even negotiated even 100% hike) as they include 20% of the CTC as variable pay  and you only get 10% of this, as company is not performing well. They negotiate hard and even make false promises but if you negotiate well you can pull off a very good salary package. Below is the guide as per designation offered: 
Senior Associate: 15-16 lakhs + CAB + internet reimbursement upto 1500
Consultant: 20-22 Lakhs +CAB + internet reimbursement upto 1500
Senior Consultant: 25-27 Lakhs + CAB + internet reimbursement upto 1500
Join at your own risk!

review_title: Review is for OFSS (Oracle Financial Services Software)
pros: The only pro this place has is You get to say you work for Oracle. All though the management and work culture is no where near Oracle.
cons:
Cons, list goes on  and on. Just to be clear this only applies to Oracle Financial Services.
I had joined Ofss thinking it will have Oracel work culture but to my disbelief it was like working In local grocery store.
-ZERO learning, if you are into testing just to let you know they do not use automation in prime sourcing. Not sure about product team
-Zero Hike, 2 years no hike at all after people start to leave they decide to give some hike in June ( usual it January). That to so little which felt like a joke.
- Only 40-50 of your veritable will be paid even after working for 9-10   hours everyday.
- Now about the project BNPP, If you are going to join that project, let me tell you run as fast you can .. and if you are joining as Tester your personal life will be ruined. Mangers will call you you anytime and ask you to work. And always threat you about KPI(which doesn't matter at the end, cause they are not going to give any hike)
-Mangment don't have sense of personal space. They just can do anything to get the work done ( that too pathetic work)
- Even though you find any other project BNPP will never release you untill you put down papers. They will always cry about budget.
- No team activity, no team lunch. With ever successful release they will send Thank you mail, which is laughable, team was asking for a small party for will they kept saying we are planning. Which actually never happen and every one stoped asking.

review_title: I honestly wouldn't recommend working at Oracle
pros:
•	You will spend less time in commute if you live in the southern part of the city as the office is quite close by. 
•	There is so much to learn here in terms of technology and applications if you take the initiative.
•	The cab service is great and pretty well aligned.
•	Good weekend and holiday working allowances.
cons:
•	The applications used here are outdated and very complicated to use. You will end up spending a lot of non-productive time in waiting for the data to get populated. Oracle also doesn’t use any third party applications.
•	There are Quarter ends which are very hectic and you might be asked to work for two weekends back to back.
•	Very bad hikes in this organization. If your review period is from April of this year to May of next year, you hike will be released only in December of next year provided there is hike for that year and there is no guarantee that all teams members would receive the hike. This is only for Manager’s favorites. There are also instances where there has been no hike for a continuous 2 years.
•	The Human Resource team right from the recruitment till Exit is very disappointing. The offer after the interview process is complete, will take about 1 to 2 months.
•	There are no HR Manager Feedback reviews with the employees to see if things are working well or not.
•	There is typically one HR business partner controlling the whole floor and most of the managers on the floor are close to the HR. Even if you go and give your feedback of some wrong doing on the floor, you will end up in soup because it won’t be kept confidential by the HR.
•	There are some managers who shout on the floor using abusive words, but these things are not taken into consideration from HR at all which is quite disappointing and you end up feeling helpless.
